alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 1:02PM PST until January 07 at 5:22PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Deschutes River Near Rainier affecting Thurston County. .Heavy rain will continue today across the region, with local low elevation snow melt. This will result in flooding on the Deschutes River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deschutes River Near Rainier. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, the Deschutes River will flood downstream in Tumwater Valley including the golf course. Minor flooding will also occur in several residential areas, mainly Cougar Mountain and Driftwood Valley. Many roads and farm lands will also be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 11.4 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 01/26/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 900 PM PST.
